sen.j: 源仁（げんにん、弘仁9年（818年）- 仁和3年11月22日 (旧暦)（887年12月14日））は、平安時代前期の真言宗の僧。
sen.e: Gennin (818 - December 14, 887) was a priest of Shingon sect in the early period of the Heian period.

sen.e: He is also called Ikegami no Sozu, Nanchiin Sozu, or Joganji Sozu.

sen.j: 護命（ごみょう）に法相教学を、ついで実恵（じちえ）に密教を学び，真雅・宗叡に灌頂を受けた。
sen.e: He learned Hosso kyogaku (Dharmalogy of the Hosso Study) under Gomyo, then learned Esoteric Buddhism under Jichie, and was held kanjo (a ceremony to be the successor) by Shinga and Shuei.

sen.j: 878年（元慶2年）内供奉十禅師に任じられ、以後883年（元慶7年）に権律師、885年（仁和元年）に少僧都・東寺二長者に至った。
sen.e: In 878, he was appointed as naikubu-juzenshi (the ten selected excellent priests for a Buddhist service in the Imperial Court), and later was appointed as Gon no Risshi (a provisional rank in the lowest managerial position) in 883 and finally became as Shosozu (junior secondary prelate) and the second manager of the To-ji Temple in 885.

sen.j: 学名が高く南池院成願寺を建立して宗義を講じた。
sen.e: He was famous for being a good scholar, and he established Nanchi-in Jogan-ji Temple and taught religious doctrine.

sen.j: 弟子の益信が広沢流を、聖宝が小野流を開いて、以後東密はこの2流に分かれた。
sen.e: His disciple Yakushin opened the Hirosawa school and Shobo opened the Ono school, so later on the Tomitsu (eastern esotericism) was divided into these two schools.
